paper_abstract: A Steiner system S(t, k, v) is called i-resolvable, 0 < i < t, if its block set can be partitioned into S(i, k, v). In this paper, a 2-resolvable S(3, 4, v) is used to construct a large set of disjoint Kirkman triple systems of order 3v - 3 (briefly LKTS) and some new orders for LKTS are then obtained.
paper_title: A construction for large sets of disjoint Kirkman triple systems
